rules.natural: Provided that an agency halts trials of a drug, the agency confirms an anomaly.
Under the condition that an agency issues a warning for a drug, the drug does not cause harm to patients.
In the event that an agency recalls a drug, it is not the case that the drug causes harm to patients.
Whenever an agency requires action for a drug, then either the agency issues a warning for the drug or the agency recalls the drug.
If a scientist falsifies data, then the scientist receives a promotion.
Either a scientist falsifies data, or if a drug is studied for a disease, then the drug is effective against the disease.
Whenever an agency investigates a scientist, then if the scientist falsifies data, it is not the case that the scientist receives a promotion.
If a drug is studied for a disease, then the drug is not effective against the disease.
Whenever an agency audits a research project, then if a scientist falsifies data, the scientist does not receive a promotion.
Either a court convicts a scientist, or an agency investigates a scientist, or an agency audits a research project.
Provided that a prosecutor files charges against a scientist, then if the court convicts the scientist, the court sentences the scientist.
A prosecutor files charges against a scientist or a prosecutor presents evidence to a court.
Under the condition that a prosecutor presents evidence to a court, then if the court convicts a scientist, the court sentences the scientist.
Whenever a drug is approved by an agency, the drug is effective against a disease.
In the event that a research project has funding from a grant, a scientist publishes results.
A research project has funding from a grant or a research project has a facility in a lab.
Under the condition that a research project has a facility in a lab, then if a drug is studied for a disease, the drug is approved by an agency.
Whenever a scientist publishes results, then if a drug is studied for a disease, the drug is approved by an agency.
Provided that a drug passes trials in a phase, the drug is effective against a disease.
Provided that a scientist reports an anomaly, it is not the case that an agency confirms the anomaly.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(approves(agency, drug) | (reports(scientist, anomaly) -> halts_trials(agency, drug))) -> causes_harm(drug, patients))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that either an agency approves a drug or if a scientist reports an anomaly then an agency halts trials of the drug, then a drug causes harm to patients.
Whenever it is not the case that if a drug is studied for a disease then the drug passes trials in a phase, a scientist reports an anomaly.
If it is not the case that if a natural phenomenon does not occur as an outbreak then a scientist does not observe an outbreak, then a drug is studied for a disease.
Provided that a natural phenomenon does not occur as an outbreak, a scientist observes an outbreak.

It is not the case that an agency approves a drug.
A court does not sentence a scientist.

target.natural: A natural phenomenon occurs as an outbreak.

(A11 → A10).natural: Provided that an agency halts trials of a drug, the agency confirms an anomaly.

(A12 ∨ (A9 → A11)).natural: Either an agency approves a drug, or if a scientist reports an anomaly, then the agency halts trials of the drug.

(A14 → ¬A13).natural: Under the condition that an agency issues a warning for a drug, the drug does not cause harm to patients.

(A14 ∨ A15).natural: An agency issues a warning for a drug or recalls a drug.

(A15 → ¬A13).natural: In the event that an agency recalls a drug, it is not the case that the drug causes harm to patients.

(A16 → (A14 ∨ A15)).natural: Whenever an agency requires action for a drug, then either the agency issues a warning for the drug or the agency recalls the drug.

(A17 → A18).natural: If a scientist falsifies data, then the scientist receives a promotion.

(A17 → ¬A18).natural: Provided that a scientist falsifies data, the scientist does not receive a promotion.

(A17 ∨ (A2 → A3)).natural: Either a scientist falsifies data, or if a drug is studied for a disease, then the drug is effective against the disease.

(A19 → (A17 → ¬A18)).natural: Whenever an agency investigates a scientist, then if the scientist falsifies data, it is not the case that the scientist receives a promotion.

(A19 ∨ A20).natural: An agency investigates a scientist or an agency audits a research project.

(A2 → A3).natural: In the event that a drug is studied for a disease, the drug is effective against the disease.

(A2 → A4).natural: Provided that a drug is studied for a disease, the drug is approved by an agency.

(A2 → A8).natural: Under the condition that a drug is studied for a disease, the drug passes trials in a phase.

(A2 → ¬A3).natural: If a drug is studied for a disease, then the drug is not effective against the disease.

(A20 → (A17 → ¬A18)).natural: Whenever an agency audits a research project, then if a scientist falsifies data, the scientist does not receive a promotion.

(A21 → A22).natural: In the event that a court convicts a scientist, the court sentences the scientist.

(A21 ∨ (A19 ∨ A20)).natural: Either a court convicts a scientist, or an agency investigates a scientist, or an agency audits a research project.

(A23 → (A21 → A22)).natural: Provided that a prosecutor files charges against a scientist, then if the court convicts the scientist, the court sentences the scientist.

(A23 ∨ A24).natural: A prosecutor files charges against a scientist or a prosecutor presents evidence to a court.

(A24 → (A21 → A22)).natural: Under the condition that a prosecutor presents evidence to a court, then if the court convicts a scientist, the court sentences the scientist.

(A4 → A3).natural: Whenever a drug is approved by an agency, the drug is effective against a disease.

(A5 → (A2 → A4)).natural: Provided that a research project has funding from a grant, then if a drug is studied for a disease, the drug is approved by an agency.

(A5 → A7).natural: In the event that a research project has funding from a grant, a scientist publishes results.

(A5 ∨ A6).natural: A research project has funding from a grant or a research project has a facility in a lab.

(A6 → (A2 → A4)).natural: Under the condition that a research project has a facility in a lab, then if a drug is studied for a disease, the drug is approved by an agency.

(A7 → (A2 → A4)).natural: Whenever a scientist publishes results, then if a drug is studied for a disease, the drug is approved by an agency.

(A8 → A3).natural: Provided that a drug passes trials in a phase, the drug is effective against a disease.

(A9 → A10).natural: In the event that a scientist reports an anomaly, an agency confirms the anomaly.

(A9 → A11).natural: Under the condition that a scientist reports an anomaly, an agency halts trials of a drug.

(A9 → ¬A10).natural: Provided that a scientist reports an anomaly, it is not the case that an agency confirms the anomaly.

(¬(A12 ∨ (A9 → A11)) → A13).prover9_expression: (-(approves(agency, drug) | (reports(scientist, anomaly) -> halts_trials(agency, drug))) -> causes_harm(drug, patients))
(¬(A12 ∨ (A9 → A11)) → A13).natural: If it is not the case that either an agency approves a drug or if a scientist reports an anomaly then an agency halts trials of the drug, then a drug causes harm to patients.

(¬(A2 → A8) → A9).natural: Whenever it is not the case that if a drug is studied for a disease then the drug passes trials in a phase, a scientist reports an anomaly.

(¬(¬G → ¬A1) → A2).natural: If it is not the case that if a natural phenomenon does not occur as an outbreak then a scientist does not observe an outbreak, then a drug is studied for a disease.

(¬G → A1).natural: Provided that a natural phenomenon does not occur as an outbreak, a scientist observes an outbreak.

(¬G → ¬A1).natural: Under the condition that a natural phenomenon does not occur as an outbreak, a scientist does not observe an outbreak.

A16.natural: An agency requires action for a drug.

¬A12.natural: It is not the case that an agency approves a drug.
